search.translation[0].definitions[0].def: an attempt to find someone or something
search.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Bad weather is hampering the search for survivors.
Two more bodies were found after a search of the woods.
search.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a series of actions done by a computer to find information
search.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: Do a search on ‘rabbit’ and see what it brings up.
a computerized search of 10,000 medical journals
search.translation[0].definitions[2].def: an attempt to find an explanation or solution
search.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: Police have carried out a search of his home.
A massive search was launched for the former soldier.
They called off the search when it got dark.
We conducted a thorough search of the building.
Police officers carried out a painstaking search of the area around the house.
They set about a systematic search of the ship.
After the war, many people returned to rural areas in a desperate search for food.
I spent many hours in a fruitless search for accommodation.
Her disappearance sparked a massive police search.
Kim was missing for two months, prompting a nationwide search.
Police are conducting house-to-house searches in the area where the girl disappeared.
Police have started a fingertip search of the area and appealed for witnesses.
The search is on for someone with the same blood type.
A search is underway for two walkers in the Cairngorm mountains.
The search area has now been widened.
search.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to try to find someone or something by looking very carefully
search.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: It was too dark to search further.
An RAF plane searched for the missing men.
I’ve searched high and low (=everywhere) for my glasses.
Detectives are searching the yard for clues.
Alice bent to search through a heap of clothes.
search.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to use a computer to find information
search.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Search the Web for cheap flights.
search.translation[1].definitions[2].def: if someone in authority searches you or the things you are carrying, they look for things you might be hiding
search.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: He was searched by the guards for weapons.
search.translation[1].definitions[3].def: to try to find an explanation or solution
search.translation[1].definitions[3].exa: Scientists are still searching for a cure.
search.translation[1].definitions[4].def: to examine something carefully in order to find something out, decide something etc
search.translation[1].note_box[0].sectio: We searched the whole house carefully, but didn’t find anything.
Panic-stricken parents frantically searched for their children.
We searched high and low for him, but couldn’t find him.
search something from top to bottom
They searched the house from top to bottom.
He searched in vain for a means of escape.
search.translation[1].note_box[1].sectio: to look carefully for someone or something
Detectives continue to search for clues.
She searched through all his clothes.
look for somebody/something
to try to get someone or something you want or need
I’m looking for something to wear for my sister’s wedding.
The band is looking for a singer.
He’s decided to look for a new career.
try to find somebody/something
used especially when someone or something is difficult to find
I spent half an hour trying to find a parking space.
She was in the kitchen, trying to find something to eat that wasn’t raw carrot.
seek
to try to find something or someone – used especially about jobs, help, or information. Also used in newspaper advertisements when trying to find a suitable person
They went there seeking work.
She decided to seek help.
Tall blond 18-year-old male seeks female 17+ for friendship.
hunt
to look for someone or something. Used when you look very carefully and thoroughly, or in the phrase house/job/bargain hunting
I’ve hunted everywhere, but I can’t find a recipe for French onion soup.
She’s gone out bargain-hunting in the sales.
be on the lookout for somebody/something
to be continuously looking for someone or something
I’m always on the lookout for a good bargain.
leave no stone unturned
to look for someone or something in every possible place
The police say they will leave no stone unturned in their search for the killer.
search.translation[2].definitions[0].def: an attempt to find someone or something, usually one that takes a lot of time
search.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: Their offer ended a five-month search for a buyer for the company.
Graduates in debt simply can’t afford lengthy job searches.
search.translation[2].definitions[1].def: when police or other people with official power look through someone’s possessions, business records etc because they think they have done something illegal
search.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: Evidence of copyright infringement was found during a recent search of the company offices.
search.translation[2].definitions[2].def: the action of looking for information in a computer’s memory or on the Internet
search.translation[2].definitions[2].exa: I did a search on the company and found out it had a lot of money in real estate.
search.translation[3].definitions[0].def: to spend time looking for someone or something
search.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: We searched the whole state for a contractor.
Geophysical methods are widely used in searching for oil.
search.translation[3].definitions[1].def: to look for information on a computer or on the Internet
search.translation[3].definitions[1].exa: You have to wait a few minutes while the software is searching.
Try searching the web using a Subject Directory Service.
I spent my lunch hour searching the Internet for a cheap flight.
